title.narrative: Programming Exercise for Country Programme in Georgia

description.narrative:
In view of Georgia’s national priority for sustainable industrial development, the Government of Georgia has recently expressed interest in deepening its cooperation with UNIDO on a number of occasions.
UNIDO is one of the implementing partners of the regional project on Resource Efficient and Cleaner Production (RECP) in six countries of the EU Eastern Partnership, including Georgia, which is part of the EC Action/Programme “Greening the Economies in the Eastern Neighborhood”. Building on the strategic importance of the above mentioned project, the Permanent Representative of Georgia to UNIDO called upon the Secretariat to extend its project portfolio in the country during a meeting with the Director General on 15 August 2013.
A fact-finding mission to Georgia was undertaken on 18-20 September 2013 to discuss potential cooperation between UNIDO and Georgia, and identify priority areas and modalities of joint work. Specifically, the Government of Georgia requests assistance in the following areas:
1. Development of small- and medium sized enterprises (SMEs) 2. Youth and women entrepreneurship 3. Export promotion and trade facilitation 4. Agro-business development 5. Green economy and green growth 6. Resource efficient and cleaner production 7. Sustainable energy sources
In a formal letter, dated 20 March 2014, Mr. Giorgi Kvirikashvili, Minister of Economy and Sustainable Development and Vice Prime Minister of Georgia, expressed the readiness of the Government to cooperate with UNIDO in funds mobilization for the creation of technical assistance projects and designated a Focal Point to facilitate the establishment of linkages with national stakeholders and for information exchange with UNIDO.
In light of the above, including the fact that UNIDO lacks field presence and has no project portfolio in the country, apart from the aforementioned regional project, it is important for UNIDO to increase its standing in Georgia and conduct a country programme formulation mission to evaluate, validate and determine in some instances, the specific areas of intervention and assistance. Depending on the outcome of the programming exercise, a Country Programme or stand-alone projects will be developed addressing the specific needs and priorities of the country.
The efforts to strengthen UNIDO’s presence in Georgia through an extended portfolio coincide with the set-up of the new Eastern Partnership (EaP) Agenda for 2014-2015 to consolidate the process of political association and economic integration of the countries of the Eastern Partnership, one of which is Georgia. It envisages enhancing multilateral cooperation in the following areas, relevant to UNIDO’s expertise: trade and economic cooperation, renewable energy and energy efficiency, environment and climate change, youth and training, business environment including SME policies and agriculture and rural development. Given the increasing harmonization of donors’ development assistance strategies with the objectives of Eastern Partnership, UNIDO should grasp the momentum and develop a diversified technical assistance portfolio for Georgia in line with the country’s priorities and EaP fields of funding interest.
